attributes.action: The government to put political pressure on the US to impose gun restrictions.
attributes.background: It is embarrassing for our nation to be in a close relationship with a country that refuses to put the safety of its citizens first. Today yet another mass shooting has taken place and over 50 members of the LGBT community have died. We can not support any government that allows this to happen.

attributes.action: Mindfulness Meditation on the Curriculum
attributes.background: Add mindfulness meditation to the school curriculum to tackle the issues of stress, anxiety and poor concentration amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details: The Science Behind Mindfulness Meditation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wP9731bDJlE

attributes.action: Reinstate the personal tax allowance for people earning over £100,000 pa.
attributes.background: Tax system flaws leave professionals paying 60 per cent tax, yet those on higher income pay just 45%.
attributes.additional_details:
Above the £10,600 tax-free personal allowance there are three bands of income tax people pay on earnings: 20pc (basic rate - from £10,600), 40pc (higher rate - from £42,385) and 45pc (additional rate - from £150,000). 

But people earning over £100,000 gradually have their personal allowance removed at a rate of £1 for every £2 earned above the threshold, up to £121,200. This means a "fourth" band of "marginal tax" is created in which they pay 60pc on income in between these levels, plus 2pc for national insurance, a total rate of 62pc. 
Workers pocket just 38pc of the income they earn between these levels. It means, ludicrously, that they pay a higher marginal tax rate than people who earn far more.

attributes.action: Send all foreign prisoners back to their countries of origin and ban them.
attributes.background: We have seen on recent BBC news programmes that the UK prison service is in a dire straight. Lack of funding, violent and dangerous it is another failing part of the UK.  Foreign criminals, many from the EU now make up a significant part of the UK inmates and are costing us a fortune.

attributes.action: Ban the Union Jack on labels and advertising on products not made in the UK
attributes.background: Customers should be able to make their choice of goods based on where products are substantially made. Whether it's sausages, clothes or electrical goods we need to have this information. Advertisers should not be able to put a Union Jack on goods that are not substantially British!

attributes.action: Ban "haul route" traffic lights on the A21 between Tunbridge Wells and Tonbridge
attributes.background: Anyone who uses the A21 between Tonbridge and Tunbridge Wells knows that the road works to widen it are essential. However the "haul route" traffic light system is not, especially in rush hour times. The undersigned feel that the use of these temporary traffic lights should be banned in rush hour.
attributes.additional_details: With these traffic lights in place a journey that normally takes 20 minutes can sometimes take over an hour. The constant cuing that results from these lights causes inconvenience, lateness, and in some cases car crashes. We feel that traffic conditions caused by these lights are dangerous and that having to get up almost an hour earlier for work/school (especially in the fast exam season), or getting home unessasarily late is unreasonable.

attributes.action: Ban diesel fuel! We deserve cleaner air.
attributes.background: Diesel fuel is slowly killing us. Let's get rid of it and live healthier, longer lives.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/apr/21/all-top-selling-cars-break-emissions-limits-in-real-world-tests

attributes.action: Standardise Breastfeeding Advice & Support
attributes.background: Breastfeeding can be hard to establish without correct support or advice. Many mothers turn to formula and regret not being able to breastfeed. I found it incredibly confusing, being given conflicting advice from one midwife to the next, and found it daughting when I went home from hospital.
attributes.additional_details: You may have heard the saying: Breast is Best, but in the UK we have a considerably low number of breastfeeding mothers compared to other European countries. A lot of mothers turn to formula through lack of support or advice. So this petition is aimed at standardising the support and advice given. We need a better structure in place to help breastfeeding mothers to establish, maintain and continue breastfeeding for as long as they wish to nurse their baby/toddler.

attributes.action: Make June 15th (signing of the Magna Carta) a bank holiday
attributes.background: Magna Carta is the foundation of our country. It is the beginning of our parliament, the oldest parliament in the world, and the origins of how we view society. So far the only memorial to it was made by the Americans who understand its importance and we should notice the Magna Carta's importance.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magna_Carta
Wiki page for the Magna Carta

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qj2vpp9Wf4
UK parliament YouTube Page with a video on the document itself

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KhVnHQVbtB8
Daniel Hannan MEP's speech on the 800th anniversary of Magna Carta - speaking at Runnymede

attributes.action: MPs and council leaders should cease second occupations until they leave office.
attributes.background: To prevent conflict of interest in the political arena, any person representing the PEOPLE should cease any activities that produce a second income.
attributes.additional_details: When persons are employed by the public purse they should put 100% of their effort into their job. It is known that some tenders for works within the public sector have directly and indirectly benefited State employed individuals. This is morally wrong and adds to the current lack of trust the Public have in our Government and Councils.

attributes.action: Plug The Loophole and Stop Cash in Hand paying No Tax, Unfair for Others Who Do
attributes.background:
The Inland Revenue must lose a great deal with Many people dealing in Cash in Hand with No Tax being Paid, Everyone Must give Invoices with Full details on them and Reciept given in every Transaction.

At this time there are far to many who Flout the System while Paye can Not, not a Level System.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people working on a self employed basis Rip the system off, make a lot of money as a Great deal does not go through the so Called books and is a Fraud but they get away with it due to the System, many Millions are Lost, there are many such areas one being Fast Food along the roads where only some goes through the books,

Others are Scrap and Rubbish around the Roads, house Clearance to name a few.

Trust this will be looked into with these issues in the Limelight.

attributes.action: Wood burning stoves should require a licence and regulated for nuisance.
attributes.background: Wood stoves create smoke and fumes that are unpleasant and dangerous to health. The government see these devices as cheap energy. Smoke and fumes produce particulates as harmful to health as diesels or secondary cigarette smoke. This fashion accessory is dangerous not romantic.
attributes.additional_details:
Building regulations are in force to ensure construction is safe, the clean air act is there to make the air we breath as safe as possible,  Environmental Health officers are there to prevent nuisance. 
Building control ignore there own rules and do not take notice of wind effect on the way smoke and fumes enter homes, Environmental Health are reluctant to make a nuisance case because the government policy is to support them, the clean air act is ignored. You cannot keep smoke and fumes out of your home and those with a duty of care ignore the risks. Even DEFRA do not know the full risks in there support of wood burning. Once installed of course anything is burnt. They need regulating and licencing.

attributes.action: Temporary Re-Nationalization of the Tata Steel - Port Talbot Plant.
attributes.background: The Steelworks are vital to the community of Port Talbot and Swansea Bay Area and if nothing is done then the wider community will suffer, So Temporary Re-Nationalization is needed to protect the jobs at the Plant. Over 3,500 Jobs depend on the Plant plus many more in the Supply Chain.

attributes.action: A higher minimum wage for people aged 18-20.
attributes.background: The minimum wage for people aged over 21 will be increasing in april. People who are younger than 21 often have the same needs as people who are over 21. Increasing the minimum wage for people under this age will encourage them to develop enriched futures.
attributes.additional_details:
People often can't afford to move out of their homes until they're over 21. If people earn more at a younger age they can save to develop their lives. This creates brighter futures for people who are unable to live with their parents well into their 20s-30s.

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates

attributes.action: Allow all children of all ages to receive the meningitis B vaccine on the NHS
attributes.background: Meningitis B is rhe most common cause of bacterial Meningitis by which children's lives are taken. As vaccines are the only way to prevent meningitis this vaccine should be offered to all children, not just those born after June 2015. It can be paid for privately which many people cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.meningitis.org/menb-vaccine

attributes.action: Make south west water improve the water treatment plant in Looe Cornwall
attributes.background: Looe in south east Cornwall has been taken over by the stench of the sewage works, especially west Looe. The odours are repugnant and is putting off holidaymakers. We also lose tourist because sewage is allowed to overflow in heavy rains affecting both the estuary and the water quality on the beach.

attributes.action: Make single carriageway A-roads safer
attributes.background: Single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. With a record £6m investment in our road network, the Government should legislate for physical barriers on single carriageway A-roads to prevent head on collisions, and for a reduction in the speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: Research by the Road Safety Foundation concluded that single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. Having been involved in a high speed head on collision on a single carriageway A-road, a physical barrier in the middle of the road would prevent unscrupulous drivers from overtaking, thus eradicating the possibility of a head on collision. Moreover, a reduction in the speed limit from 60mph would also further improve road safety.

attributes.action: Vets to be regulated by a independent governing body impartially from the RCVS
attributes.background:
Vets are not regulated by any real governing body at present, and can charge as much as they like, and go back on their word. 
They can give the wrong advise to a owner which can be costly and put a animal through unnecessary treatments.
It needs to be regulated like all other services.
attributes.additional_details:
A vet can offer a service but then change their mind at a later date, for example offering to put a animal to sleep for free as they animal had surgery on their advice which made the situation worse and the animal to suffer more, and then charge the owner at a later date. 
Vets also prey on owners whose animal is sick and put profit ahead of the animals well being, and the RCVS can do little to help.
They are not answerable to anything and this needs to change.

attributes.action:
Create non-geographical parliamentary 
constituencies for our Armed Forces.
attributes.background: Depending on individual circumstances, service personnel register to vote using an address which is either: their current address; one where they would reside but for their service, or a previous address. Thus personnel at any one location may be represented by MPs, from across the political divide.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Armed Forces deserve to elect their own MPs, rather than have them chosen by an electorate with little appreciation of service life and the conditions under which the military operate both here and abroad.
Without independent representation, or a formal federation, our Armed Forces are unable to make their views known in a coherent manner.  Non-geographical constituencies will enable service personnel to elect their own MPs, wherever they serve or live, and be seen as an identifiable entity.

attributes.action: To have a 'No Bullying' Campaign/Policy in all educational sites across the UK.
attributes.background: During my time at school I had my fair share of bullying and was made to feel out of place. Speaking with local parents, who think schools don't do enough to prevent bullying, would like the government to set strict guidelines that must be followed in education for bullying, not set by the schools.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/bullying-at-school/the-law - says that policies are set by the school. If it was set by the government then all schools would be the same regarding the 'Behaviour Policy'. Schools could also teach that everyone is different have it be sexual orientation or religion, race which could prevent bullying. I will be campaigning to STOP THE BULLYING!! 

Questionnaire below:
https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/LZNSF7K
Will be sent to schools and colleges around the UK for research.

attributes.action: Keep the production, sale and use of cannabis illegal.
attributes.background: Cannabis is a harmful drug. It's not a recreational substance that should be classed as "legal" as doing this will only make it more accessible to vulnerable young people and consequently cause more damage to our society.

attributes.action: Increase the interest rate freelancers can claim for late payment.
attributes.background: Under the Late Payment of Commercial Debts Act 1998, Businesses can claim 8% interest plus the current Bank of England base rate. However this is not enough to deter larger companies from taking advantage of freelancers carrying out non-contracted work, i.e a one-off job.
attributes.additional_details: Late payment can severely impact a freelancer especially during a period of no work therefore it is important that they are able to claim fair compensation, not only to deter companies from exploiting them but to live. If a freelancer were to work one day for £100 and were not paid within 30 days of the client receiving the invoice, the freelancer could claim 8.25% interest (Bank of England base rate of 0.25%) meaning the annual interest would be £8.25 (approximately 0.0226 pence per day).

attributes.action: Hear the voices of the young adult disabled fighting to be heard
attributes.background: From the age of 18 young disabled people are put into the adult age bracket, but little or nothing is offered for this age group. Overnight they lose majority of the help given to children and do not come into account again until they become pensioners. Though mentally they are still children.
attributes.additional_details: Young adults are forgotten when it comes to living as normal a life as possible. Government need to make it law that they are entitled to the same as childrens services instead of leaving it to their parents. Some of who are elderly or even disabled themselves.

attributes.action: Remove roadside signs supported on steel girders
attributes.background: As a retained firefighter for Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service I have recently attended  an rtc where a van came into contact with a roadside motorway sign which was mounted on steel girders. This collision left the driver with life changing injuries. There are a number of these signs on the m3.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the construction of these signs is a danger to life and there appears to be more lightweight options available that are in use in other areas of the motorway system. A vehicle coming into contact with these signs supported on steel girders will quiet simply be cut in half by the force of the collision. I recently attended an incident on the m3 near Basingstoke where a driver lost a leg.

attributes.action: Increase the Carer's Allowance to £80 per week, from £62.10 per week
attributes.background: There are an estimated 6.5 million carers in the UK, meaning that 1 in 10 people have caring duties. Unpaid carers save the UK government £119 billion per year, more than is spent on the NHS. To receive the carers allowance, you must care for 35 hours a week, when many care for 100 hours or more.
attributes.additional_details: Working up to 100 hours, the Carer's Allowance equates to 62p per hour, in contrast to the minimum wage of £7.20 per hour. The burden of caring is great, with 625,000 carers suffering from mental or physical illnesses - around the population of Glasgow. The problem will only get worse with 6,000 people becoming carers every day - these people need help now.

attributes.action: Introducing funding to help those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: There are many people in the UK that are experiencing mental health issues. This is a problem as people are still suffering from theses issues and not had the support needed. This has caused people to be in a worse situation than they would of if the had the support in the first place.
attributes.additional_details: This is important to me as i am experiencing this myself. I am wanting to change this  and stop making people waiting for professional help and get the qualified people in. By raising awareness we can make those vulnerable people and their friends and families feel they are not alone and make more peoples lives better. This can be done with more advertisement, more qualified professionals to set up more social action projects and one to one appointments.

attributes.action: Lowering the state pension age for women born in the 50s back to 60 years old.
attributes.background: My mother was born on the 10th december 1953, if she was born 4 days earlier she would have retired 2 and half years ago. I'm sure a lot of the country is in the same situation. There wasn't enough time for people born in the 50s to save. This needs to change back to the state pension age of 60.

attributes.action: Make horse riders pick up their horses excrement! Or slap them with a fine!
attributes.background: Why should horse riders get away with leaving massive piles of dump in the middle of the road and down our streets, when dog owners get slapped with a massive fine for a little dump! All pets should be treated with the same rules! No excuses!

attributes.action: Ask for 'EU Membership for Individuals', when negotiating leaving EU.
attributes.background: Education
attributes.additional_details:
A choice for individuals who wish 'To travel/study/work ' for £4:50 week or any other amount deemed reasonable.
It excludes public health and benefits, if no reciprocal arrangement by the EU, since the main cause of  Brexit was the magnetic state benefits package, allowed by the UK.
This is not designed to encourage mass migration, but to allow individuals to persue visa free travel, and to study and work to broaden their horizons, learn languages and foster good relations.

attributes.action: Stop members of terrorist organisations such as ISIS returning to the UK
attributes.background: I think that terrorist members shouldn't be aloud as they are a threat to national security. They've been acting against British laws and they are against British values and it has been reported that thousands of ISIS fighters have been granted permission to come back into the country
attributes.additional_details: If they re-enter the United Kingdom then I think that they should stand trial.

attributes.action: Scrap interest rates on student loans.
attributes.background: Interest charged on student loans should be scrapped for everyone who has one and for students of the future. The continual rise in the interest charged is making paying the loans back even harder and unfair.

attributes.action: Make CPD (Continual professional development) mandatory for the beauty industry.
attributes.background: Most professions in the UK (Dentists, Doctors, Solicitors, Journalists etc... require a minimum number of CPD (Continual Professional Development training hours) to be completed each year. This is training to keep updated in your industry.
attributes.additional_details: The beauty industry needs skilled therapists that are dedicated to improving their skills and remained up-to-date in health and safety of the benefit of both themselves, their clients and the image of this massive industry.

attributes.action: Sizeably increase and improve upon current funding for domestic abuse refuges.
attributes.background: Between early 2015 and '16, 30 refuges were forced to close as a result of inadequate funding. There are currently 272 refuges across the UK, sharing between them just £20 million of annual government funding. This lack of funding is, in part, responsible for 2 domestic female homicides every week.
attributes.additional_details: Domestic abuse refuges save lives. But they are in dire straits; scarce government funding serves merely to 'patch up' issues which reemerge in exacerbated form each year. Refuges have excessively suffered from recent spending cuts, with 44% of services in 2015 operating without any reliable funding over the previous year. On just one day in 2015, 167 women and children were turned away from 129 refuges nationwide, with 23.27% of referrals in said year being declined out of financial necessity.

attributes.action: Make rail companies social enterprises instead of profit-making parasites
attributes.background: The shambolic performance of Southern rail shows that the system is broken. People are in fear of losing their jobs because they cannot reliably get a train to work. Parents spend little time with their children because of delayed journeys home. Who and what are the rail companies for?

attributes.action: Make GCSE politics and law compulsory.
attributes.background: The EU referendum results showed that people are easily manipulated by media and propaganda and should have a good basis understanding of law and politics before they should be able to decide the future of the country.

attributes.action: Make disabled spaces legally enforceable and a legal requirement.
attributes.background: While there are disabled bays provided at most buildings with parking, there is no legal requirement to provide them. The spaces are often abused; disabled drivers can very often not get parked in a bay with the space they need to get in and out, and which is close to the entrance.
attributes.additional_details:
Request

I would like two things. Firstly, I would like to see it made a legal requirement for buildings with parking spaces to provide disabled slots.

Secondly, I would like to see it made an offence to park in a disabled space without the appropriate authority - e.g. a blue badge for instance.

attributes.action: Rights to vote for all migrants who have resided in the UK for the past 5 years.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to extend the right to vote for the EU referendum to the migrants that have lived and worked in the UK for the past 5 years. We call a second referendum open to this minority that has not been included in the vote but that will be directly affected by it.

attributes.action: Review Visa requirements of the families of serving Commonwealth Soldiers
attributes.background: I highlight the case of a Fijian Soldier who is serving in the British Army who has been separated from his family due to current UK Visa laws. As this soldier does not earn the £27,000 required, his family are forced to remain in Fiji. He is also required to find £6000 just for a Visa application.
attributes.additional_details: The soldier in question served in Afghanistan then discharged from the Army. He subsequently rejoined into the MPGS. His family moved back to Fiji and are now unable to join him. He has seen his family once for 2 weeks in three years. It is unfair to have free movement within Europe yet serving Soldiers are unable to be accompanied due to archaic Visa regulations

attributes.action: Make it illegal to run politically-biased opinions on newspaper front-covers.
attributes.background: Newspaper editors often use front-covers as opinion pieces to influence public opinion. For example, in the countdown to the EU referendum, many ran headlines encouraging the public to vote one way or another. We call on an end to this practice. Front-covers should report the news, not opinion.

attributes.action: Make all 'Brexit' discussions open to public scrutiny.
attributes.background:
Transparency within the European Union has been a real concern since its conception, it was also a significant argument in the Brexit 'debate'.

In a democracy the elected are accountable to the electorate and accountability demands transparency.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have made the decision to leave the EU and they have the right to hear all the negotiations conducted in their name.

We call on David Cameron and all other UK representatives not to enter any negotiations unless they are fully minuted and broadcast live via radio or television.

Furthermore, we call upon our government officials to insist any 'Brexit' negotiations held by our EU partners which exclude UK representatives be fully minuted and broadcast live.

attributes.action: Act against the post-EU referendum increase in racial and religious hate crime
attributes.background: We are ashamed by the reported increase in racially and religiously motivated hate crimes following the EU referendum. We ask politicians to provide additional funding for anti-racism initiatives and community support, and to ensure that the police and CPS investigate and prosecute offenders.

attributes.action: Hold independence referendums for London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: The people of London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland are at risk of being taken out of the EU, despite voting heavily to remain. If Scotland is granted a 2nd independence referendum as a result of this, then the same choice should be granted to both London and Northern Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
EU referendum results as reported by the BBC:

London: "Across all 33 boroughs in the capital, 59.9% (2.26 million) voted in favour of remaining in the EU. In some areas, the remain vote was more than 70%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36612916

Scotland: "Scotland has voted in favour of the UK staying in the EU by 62% to 38% - with all 32 council areas backing Remain."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-politics-36599102

Northern Ireland: "Northern Ireland has voted to remain in the EU Referendum by a majority of 56% to 44%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-36614443

attributes.action: Make its so cars don't have to have their number plates on the front.
attributes.background: I don't see it fair that motorbikes are aloud to ride around the uk streets with just a back number plate and no front one, so I think that cars should only have to have a back number plate aswell.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the misleading information by the EU Leave Campaign
attributes.background:
The nation's decision on Europe must be based wholly upon an informed choice and not upon misleading campaigns of false information provided by the Leave Campaign.
We ask such debate to take place in Parliament before any debate enacting Article 50 or any vote on it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/16/nigel-farage-defends-ukip-breaking-point-poster-queue-of-migrants
http://m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_576e2967e4b08d2c56393241?edition=uk 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36353013
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H8TA631ou0 and http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/eu-referendum-result-nigel-farage-nhs-pledge-disowns-350-million-pounds-a7099906.html
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/3-brexit-promises-campaigners-wriggled-8271762 and 
http://qz.com/715877/the-backtracking-on-promises-by-brexit-campaigners-has-already-begun/

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: Give the rest of the UK a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain.
attributes.background: If Scotland decides on a 2nd referendum to leave or remain with the UK then the rest of the UK simultaneously should have a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain. If EITHER referendum indicate that Scotland should leave then they must leave the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The future of the UK should be decided by all of the residents of the UK and not just a minority.

attributes.action: Ensure participation in EU free trade, science, security, & environment programs
attributes.background: Now we have voted to leave the EU we must ensure that we will keep access to as many of the EU structures and programs that have been so beneficial to the UK over the years. We ask the government to negotiate access to these programs including free trade, science, security, & environment programs

attributes.action: Hold a new EU referendum if there is a major shift in public opinion.
attributes.background: The consequences of leave have, until now, been pure speculation.  They are now facts and becoming clear: a fall in the pound, threatened major job losses, the break up of the UK.  Had these consequences been clear before the vote, the public may have voted differently and should confirm the vote.

attributes.action: make no cuts to Access To Work at the DWP.
attributes.background: Access to work is the only way to  help employers to employ  disabled people.  It must not be cut.
attributes.additional_details: My name is David wilkins and I am a totally blind and partially deaf Freelance Journalist.

attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.
